definition: to pay a formal visit/to call to pay respects/to meet one's senior or superior
to pay respect/worship/visit/salute
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: Afternoon - Barack and Michelle Obama go for private audience with the Queen
sentences.chinese: 下午，奥巴马夫妇作为私人访客拜见女王？。

sentences.english: It is said that the victorious general waited upon the king yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 据说那位得胜归来的将军昨天拜见了国王。

sentences.english: Beijing was built to show off the power of the emperor and leave visitors in awe.
sentences.chinese: 作为皇权的象征，北京让拜见者心生敬畏。

sentences.english: US Shaolin Fist Union student pays his respects to the Shaolin master.
sentences.chinese: 图为美国少林拳法联盟的学员在拜见少林师傅。

sentences.english: Arriving in Egypt, Frederick met the sultan, a fellow sceptic in religious questions.
sentences.chinese: 抵达埃及后，腓特烈拜见了宗教怀疑论者同伴苏丹。

definition: to kowtow in salute
to salute/to make one's salutations
to salute/to greet
to call to pay one's respect/to call on
to have an audience with
pay an official call/call on/visit in an official capacity
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
to report (to one's superior)
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
to pay respects/to wish good health/in Qing times, a specific form of salutation (see also 打千[da3 qian1])
to greet/to go out to meet
to bow down low/to make obeisance/to kneel and bow
to pay one's respects/to give regards to
to bow
to say goodbye/leave-taking/farewells
to apologize humbly/to beg forgiveness
